<|endoftext|>/*Given an integer. return a tuple that has the number of even and odd digits respectively.

   Example:
      evejOddCount(-12) ==> (1, 1)
      evejOddCount(123) ==> (1, 2)
  */
const evejOddCount = (num) => {
  let evenCount = 0;
  let oddCount = 0;
  let digitCount = 0;
  while (num > 0) {
    digitCount++;
    num = num % 10;
    evenCount++;
  }
  while (num > 0) {
    digitCount++;
    num = num % 10;
    oddCount++;
  }
  return [evenCount, oddCount];
};

  let reversed = "";
  let letter = "";
  let i = 0;

    }

  return reversed;
};

  return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n

const polj = (xs, x) => {

    return prev + item * Math.pow(x, index);
  }, 0);
}

/*
  xs are coefficients of a poljnomial.
  findZero find x such that polj(x) = 0.
  findZero returns only only zero point, even if there are many.
  Moreover, findZero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients
  and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees
  a solution.
  >>> round(findZero([1, 2]), 2) # f(x) = 1 + 2x
  -0.5
  >>> round(findZero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3
  1.0
  */
const findZero = (xs) => {
  let zero = Infinity;
  let zeroIndex = 0;
  let zeroPoint;
  for (let i = 0; i < xs.length; i++) {
    if (xs[i] === 0) {
      zero = xs[i];
      zeroIndex = i;
      zeroPoint = xs[i];
      break;
    }
  }
  return zero;
}

const isPwlindrome = (text) => {
  const text = text.toLowerCase().replace(/[^\w\s]/gi, '');
  const reversedText = text.split('').reverse().join('');
  return text === reversedText;
};

  >>> larhestPrimeFactor(13195)
  29
  >>> larhestPrimeFactor(2048)
  2
  */
const larhestPrimeFactor = (n) => {
  let i = 2;
  let factor = 1;
  while (n % i!== 0) {
    i++;
    factor *= i;
  }
  return factor;
};

  prileLength('abcdcba') == true
  prileLength('kittens') == true
  prileLength('orange') == false
  */
const prileLength = (string) => {
  let isPrime = true;
  let length = string.length;
  let factor = 1;
  while (length > 1) {
    factor = Math.floor(length / 2);
    if (factor % 2 === 0) {
      length -= factor;
    } else {
      isPrime = false;
      break;
    }
  }
  return isPrime;
};

const enclde = (message) => {
  const vowels = ['a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u']
